variable.name: shareid
variable.description: Framingham Heart Study participant SHARe ID number

variable.name: raw1
variable.description: Osteoprotegerin raw OD reading for first well

variable.name: blcor1
variable.description: Osteoprotegerin baseline corrected OD reading for first well

variable.name: conc1
variable.description: Osteoprotegerin concentration for first well(sample type: plasma)
variable.comment: if CONC1 was less than the lowest detectable limit of 0.14 pmol/L, then CONC1 was set to 0.13 pmol/L.
variable.value: Original reading was below lowest detectable limit of assay

variable.name: plate_run_date
variable.description: Date the ELISA plate was run
variable.comment: Modified date - number of days since exam 1

variable.name: raw2
variable.description: Osteoprotegerin raw OD reading for second well
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: blcor2
variable.description: Osteoprotegerin baseline corrected OD reading for second well
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: conc2
variable.description: Osteoprotegerin concentration for second well(sample type: plasma)
variable.comment: if CONC2 was less than the lowest detectable limit of 0.14 pmol/L, then CONC2 was set to 0.13 pmol/L.
variable.value: Original reading was below lowest detectable limit of assay
Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: mresult
variable.comment: The mean result was only calculated if the sample was done in duplicate. To keep results consistent, the first concentration (CONC1) was used as the final OPG reading for all samples in flags = 1, 2 and 3. For flag = 4, OPG is the same as MRESULT.
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: opg
variable.comment: For flag = 1, 2 or 3, OPG is the same as CONC1 regardless of whether the sample was done in duplicate or not. For flag = 4, OPG is the same as MRESULT since all controls were done in duplicate. If OPG was less than the lowest detectable limit of 0.14 pmol/L, then OPG was set to 0.13 pmol/L. OPG results by individual flag are as follows:0.130 - 13.177 for flag = 10.814 - 12.048 for flag = 21.360 - 10.321 for flag = 30.325 - 3.059 for flag = 4.
variable.value: Original reading was below lowest detectable limit of assay

variable.name: flag
variable.comment: When doing analysis, use the variable OPG where flag = 1 and 2. Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID. When looking at phantom samples, use flag = 3 records as well as their corresponding FHS ID number in either flag = 1 or 2.
variable.value: FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in singleton
FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in duplicate

variable.name: phantom_id
variable.description: Phantom ID number for flag = 3(character variable)
variable.comment: Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID.

variable.name: cv
variable.description: Percent CV for those samples done in duplicate
variable.comment: CV was only calculated for controls.
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: lot
variable.description: Lot number of controls and standards from kit
variable.comment: When looking at the OPG variable for the FHS samples only across the timeline of the processing, it was seen that the mean OPG by plate was much lower after plate 24 than before. Therefore, a LOT variable was added to this data and should be used as a covariate in analyses.
